data.text: Hardcover. 326 pages. *** PUBLISHING DETAILS: Collins, UK, 1997. First Edition. *** CONDITION: The book itself is in good (ex-library) condition and comes in good dust jacket. More specifically: Ex-library with usual marks, stamps, stickers. Boards have no wear, rubbing or soiling. Dust jacket has light creasing. Edges of dust jacket have moderate bumping. Dust jacket is unclipped. Dust jacket is protected in clear, plastic sleeve. Pages are reasonably tanned, mildly foxed and lightly creased. *** ABOUT THIS BOOK: In 17th-century Portugal, Mariana de Alcoforado, a nobleman's daughter and a nun since the age of ten, shocks the convent by having an affair with a French soldier. The novel is based on the true story of one of Europe's most notorious love affairs. *** Quantity Available: 1. Category: Fiction; Romance & Women's Fiction; ISBN: 0002255731. ISBN/EAN: 9780002255738. Inventory No: 20040348. Hardcover
